entry.title: All I ask
entry.summary:
Author: The_Inefable_mexa17

Rating: MatureLanguage: EnglishWords: 7,396Chapters: 12/12Kudos: 57

Summary: “We should talk” Buck said sitting at the kitchen table his coffee in his hands. They had gotten up and made breakfast, just like the times Buck spent the night on the couch.“Yeah” Eddie leaned back on the countertop.“We were drunk, and it was stupid, plus you are straight” Buck said.“I don’t think I’m straight” Eddie laughed.“I mean” Buck took a sip in his coffee “it doesn’t have to mean anything”“Right” Eddie’s heart sunk but he nodded “And you just got dump”“So you agree” Buck smiled “This doesn’t have to ruin our friendship or change anything.”“Yeah of course, dude” Eddie buried his feelings, something that he was good at “Nothing has to change"orBuck and Eddie sleep together the night Buck got dumped, but decided they should stay friends. But when Eddie decided to move to texas to be closer to his son, they are force to face their feelings

entry.title: The Good I’ll Do
entry.summary:
Author: ScribblesAfterDark

Rating: Teen And Up AudiencesLanguage: EnglishWords: 5,178Chapters: 3/24Kudos: 30

Summary: “I leave in a week,” Eddie said quietly. “Minimum Five-month deployment.”The spoon clattered against the counter, the sharp sound cutting through the air. Buck’s jaw tightened, his eyes narrowing with something too tangled to be just anger. “Five months? You were supposed to be done in three. No more deployments…We were supposed to finally settle down. Put down some roots. Be on the same fucking continent for more than a few months at a time.”Or, They survived deployments and the kind of chaos only Buck could attract. Falling in love should’ve been the easy part. Now married and raising Christopher, they’ve finally built the family they once only dreamed about…except Eddie’s been deployed again, and long-distance is proving tougher than any mission.

entry.title: Where The Lavender Grows Wild
entry.summary:
Author: rose_quartz_queen

Rating: MatureLanguage: EnglishWords: 17,179Chapters: 7/?Kudos: 26

Summary: "From his vantage point on the museum steps, Buck can see Eddie for a little longer than Eddie can see him, and he watches as Eddie scans the crowd. Buck’s heart flutters in his chest, feeling like it's going to explode. He can still go home, he thinks, he can still leave. If he turns around right now, Buck can go home before Eddie even knows he was there. He can pack up his locker at work and leave, just like he did in Pennsylvania and South America. "After a not-quite-unexpected kiss, Buck and Eddie finally begin their journey as more than friends. However, as the pair get to know each other in a new way, Buck must finally come to terms with and heal from the past he has worked so hard to bury.A slow-burn fic exploring what it means to fall in love and find happiness after trauma.

entry.title: The Bacon Patent Incident
entry.summary:
Author: IdoGeek

Rating: General AudiencesLanguage: EnglishWords: 15,156Chapters: 1/1Kudos: 51

Summary: “Mr. Buckley?” A crisp voice, professional and bright. “This is Sara from Hormel Foods. We’d like to discuss licensing your resealable bacon packaging patent.”Buck blinked. He was halfway between the sink and the counter, holding an only-mostly-clean dish towel in one hand like a flag of truce. His brain did a little stutter-step, then fell directly through a trapdoor.“My what?”“Your patent,” Sara said smoothly, as if this conversation happened every day (maybe it did, in her world). “Approved three weeks ago.”“Approved,” he repeated, like a child testing a new word. The towel slipped out of his fingers and landed on the floor with a soft thud. “My patent is… approved?”“Yes,” she said, still crisp. “Mr. Buckley, do you have a few minutes? Our legal team is prepared to make an offer for licensing rights in select categories. We—”ORBuck becomes a multimillionaire overnight thanks to ADHD and spite because he really really really hates not resealable bacon packaging

entry.title: War Of Hearts
entry.summary:
Author: miladystark

Rating: Not RatedLanguage: EnglishWords: 15,144Chapters: 13/?Kudos: 351

Summary: Lieutenant Commander Evan Buckley has survived war zones, covert missions, and enough explosions to fill a lifetime—but nothing prepared him for Staff Sergeant Eddie Diaz, the army medic with a sharp tongue and zero regard for rank.They clash, they fight, they bleed—and somewhere between they start to fall. Slowly. Stupidly. Against all odds. Because in a world where every second counts, love is the one thing they never trained for. Sergeant Eddie Diaz didn’t look up until he heard boots and yelling.“Careful!” he said, deadpan, as the team deposited Buck—still resisting—onto the cot. “We wouldn’t want to bruise his ego any further.”“You’re the medic?” Buck growled, glaring up at the man with messy curls and sharp eyes.“No,” Eddie replied dryly, pulling on gloves. “I’m the fairy godmother. You got a wish?”

entry.title: The sky could fall on me (But you mean more to me)
entry.summary:
Author: WhisperingHope

Rating: MatureLanguage: EnglishWords: 29,257Chapters: 7/?Kudos: 110

Summary: Evan Buckley has the worst luck. He knows it. His team knows it. Maddie dealt with it his entire upbringing. It’s become a simple fact of life. The sky is blue, grass is green, and Evan Buckley has god-awful luck. If a crushed leg (due to toppled fire truck), a pulmonary embolism at the ripe age of 27, being caught in a tsunami with his best friend’s son, and an honest to god lightning strike weren’t enough proof of the matter, stepping on a bomb is all the confirmation he really didn’t need.Edmundo Diaz has faced far too much death in his lifetime to be afraid of it. In fact, he’s spent most of his life staring down the barrel of a gun, metaphorically and physically. Quite honestly, Santa Muerte himself could appear before Eddie’s very eyes and he would just count it as another Tuesday. So being in close proximity to a live explosive? Not even the worst thing he’s had to deal with in recent years. Really, not even the worst thing he's had to deal with this week. But his best friend standing on the trigger? Eddie’s never been afraid of death. Until he found himself standing between it and his best friend.

entry.title: Chris's Dumbass Dads
entry.summary:
Author: James_Madison_617

Rating: General AudiencesLanguage: EnglishWords: 1,422Chapters: 1/1Kudos: 37

Summary: Being back in LA had its ups and downs. Mostly ups, but the main downside was watching his dad and Buck dance around each other like two birds doing a mating dance for the last six months. Now since Buck was living in their house, there weren't enough rooms for them all to have their own. So brilliantly the two men decided they'd share a room. And a bed. The kicker: they weren't together.Don't get him wrong, Chris was pretty convinced they were lying to him in the beginning. Then he remembered how stupid his dads could be and realized they probably weren't together. Eight years. Two more months of this and he might have to lock them in a closet together until they figure it out.Highschool was fun. He had friends and classes he liked. Unfortunately, said friends were also quite insufferable on occasion. He sat down in art class, his friend sitting next to him, a smile on her face. "Any updates?"She'd been far too invested in Buck and Eddie's love life since they met in middle school. "Buck flirted with dad and he walked into a wall." Chris sighed.Or,Chris's friend is very invested in Buddie

entry.title: Between Floors
entry.summary:
Author: Iceprincess96

Rating: Not RatedLanguage: EnglishWords: 2,457Chapters: 1/1Kudos: 32

Summary: Eddie has always struggled with a slight fear of enclosed spaces since the well incident, but he’s managed to keep it under control.After Chris leaves, Eddie begins taking increasingly reckless risks, which sparks a heated confrontation with Buck.When their fight escalates and the two find themselves trapped in an elevator, they must confront more than just the confined space—can they put their differences aside, face their fears, and come out stronger on the other side?

entry.title: by the ring, by their side
entry.summary:
Author: arsortel

Rating: Not RatedLanguage: EnglishWords: 8,422Chapters: 1/1Kudos: 2

Summary: "And he does see it. He’s seeing it all; every speck of smoke, and dust, and pain; the once painted-white wood of a porch that ached to carry twin rocking chairs being consumed by never-ending waves of fire. He’s branding it into his brain, engraving it so deep he’ll never forget seeing it."or; eddie diaz angst, because every piece of him is worth seeing.

entry.title: Curse Me to Death
entry.summary:
Author: James_Madison_617

Rating: Teen And Up AudiencesLanguage: EnglishWords: 3,463Chapters: 1/1Kudos: 39

Summary: He knows it’s horrible to think, but Buck knew that it was his fault everyone around him died. One’s an accident. Two’s a coincidence. Three is a pattern. By the sixth it’s just extra data to add to the pattern chart. Six people who are no longer alive because Buck is a curse to this world.Eddie would probably scold him for believing in curses and superstitions, but he can’t see any other reason this has happened. He is a jinx. A bad luck charm. He makes things so much worse than they have to be. He’s the only common denominator in all of these incidents. The only extra data that each of them match. Buck is the reason they all kill themselves; he has to be. If not, then why does this keep happening to him?Or,Buck thinks that Eddie killed himself during his PTSD episode

Author: worksbyjas

Summary: The odds of getting struck by lightning twice is 1 in 9 million.Evan Buckley beats the odds.After the incident, Buck struggles to decipher what’s real or not. Especially, since someone starts to follow him. Haunt him, even.Someone or something.A familiar face.Daniel Buckley.
